roleset.name: to work together, act festively together
roleset.note: PARTY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'party' based on sentences in ECTB. No Verbnet entry found. Verbnet frames for conspire-36.1 and meet-36.3-1 considered. (from party.01-v predicate notes)
PARTY-N NOTES: Based on verb entry party.01; no existing VN entry. (from party.01-n)

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: The damage to his credibility was too much after Eustachy admitted he partied with students at rival schools , and that he 's an alcoholic .

example.name: ARG0
example.text: committing sexual sin , being morally bad , doing all kinds of shameful things , worshiping false gods , taking part in witchcraft , hating people , causing trouble , being jealous , angry or selfish , causing people to argue and divide into separate groups , being filled with envy , getting drunk , having wild parties , and doing other things like this .

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: As the Scriptures say , `` [The people]-1 sat down to eat and drink and then got up PRO-1 to have a wild party . ''

example.name: Attributive and Benefactive
example.text: We are throwing a bachelor party for Fred.

example.name: Partying, all arguments
example.text: Obama's partying with millionaires and corporate leaders raised eyebrows considering the deficit.
